title: Mobile Microlearning-Based Agricultural Knowledge Exchange Network: Foundational Language Communication Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone usage skills, general interest in agriculture, foundational grammar comprehension, and language expression ability at a daily conversation level
context.additional_context: Operates in smartphone-based limited-technology environments, emphasizing sharing real agricultural knowledge-exchange experiences through integrated language communication (reading, writing, listening, speaking) via project-based assessments. Supports vocabulary expansion and context-appropriate expression skills.

learning_goals: Learners can explain text-based communication strategies for effective language exchange in agricultural knowledge networks

Using smartphone-based microlearning tools (e.g., KakaoTalk Open Chat, Band), learners collaborate with three peer farmers to create two crop cultivation experience-sharing posts (considering grammatical accuracy, vocabulary diversity, and logical structure) and provide constructive feedback (clarity, practicality, empathetic expression) on at least one peer post

After a one-week short course, learners specify three practical strategies for building local agricultural networks (producer-consumer direct trade platform, co-branding, distribution cooperative) in a project report and explain two core strategies with structured language (introduction-body-conclusion) in a 5-minute presentation

resources: Agricultural Case Study Videos and Image Resources
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
